intro: Echites yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan echites, is a flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, cylindrical fruiting structures that contain seeds dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
